content.description: Nice positive hand jams gets you up to the rail, continue jamming with good feet at the top. This is a rather easy non committing problem to jump on before trying "just the tip".
content.location: This can be accessed through the Douglas blvd, folsom lake entrance. ($12 entance fee i believe?) Continue all the way to the back of the 3 mile windy road until you hit the parking lot for Beaks Bight. There are some boulder problems right out of the parking lot that you can't miss, however this boulder problem and a few others are located further. Continue along one of the trails or hike down to the water and follow the water line towards auburn for approx 3/4 mile until you come to a meadow with three large houses up on the hill (the backside of Los Lagos). In this meadow you will find a large slabby boulder problem that can't be missed, and up towards the hill that the houses are on you will see this boulder.

content.description: Pull into the crack at the base, the climb quickly turns into a THIN crack that only allows for finger tips. Follow the crack to the top and then pull onto the top. Not your typical boulder problem, this is some hard crack climbing
